text:
Reject H, if: test statistic < -1.96 or
test statistic > 1.96
Figure 2 shows the standard normal distribution for a two-tailed hypothesis test using
the z-distribution. Notice that the significance level of 0.05 means that there is 0.05 / 2
= 0.025 probability (area) under each tail of the distribution beyond £1.96.
Figure 2: Two-Tailed Hypothesis Test Using the Standard Normal (2) Distribution
